name: Electricity, at grid, US, 2000
description:
Important note: although most of the data in the US LCI database has 
undergone some sort of review, the database as a whole has not yet 
undergone a formal validation process.
Please email comments to lci@nrel.gov.

category.name: 2211: Electric Power Generation, Transmission and Distribution

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Representative of year 2000 mix of fuels used for utility electricity generation in the U.S. Fuels include coals, fuel oil, nuclear, hydroelectric, and unconventional energy sources. Data are weighted according to percent share of consumption. Includes line loss factor of 9.91%, which represents the difference between electricity generated and electricity sold.
processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: All information can be accessed by everybody.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: United States, excluding Alaska and Hawaii.

exchanges.description: Accounts for average line losses of 9.91%
